[ccW lines="-1"]1. You request IPv6 glue for your nameservers through: _ARIN __IETF __RIPE _The registrar of the domain used by your name servers X 2. IPv6 glue for nameservers resides on which nameservers? The TLDs' X The ROOTs Your own

  1. Which of the following queries proves working IPv6 glue? dig AAAA ns1.exampledomain.tld @tld.server X dig -x 2001:db8::1 @tld.server dig A ns1.exampledomain.tld @tld.server ping ns1.exampledomain.tld

  2. Which TLD listed below is authoritative for .com & .net IPv6 Glue? A.GTLD-SERVERS.net X a0.org.afilias-nst.info ipv6.arpa GDNS1.ULTRADNS.NET

  3. What is another name sometimes used for A or AAAA nameserver glue records found in the top level domain zone files? CNAME records GHOST records host records X PTR records

  4. What is a registrar? An organization that is able to register domains X A notary A glue record A nameserver

  5. What is a registry? An organization responsible for operating the authorative nameservers and database for a top level domain X A host record A nameserver A notary

  6. Why does getting AAAA records for your nameservers in the corresponding TLD (top level domain) zone matter? It enables entirely native IPv6 DNS queries and makes it possible for IPv6 only hosts to reach the nameservers for your domain, since they can’t use glue that is just an A record. X It doesn’t. It’s too hard, so you shouldn’t bother. It registers your domain It provides reverse DNS for your domain

  7. IPv6 AAAA records have been added for several of the root nameservers. False True X

  6. How many /48 subnets are available in a /32 prefix? 256 XX 6 128 XX 65536 X

  7. Which protocol is used for manually configured tunnels? 6to4 6in4 X Teredo

  8. Which of the following is the IPv6 documentation prefix? ::/8 XX 2002::/16 XX 2001:db8::/32 X fe80::/10

  9. Which of the following is the IPv6 link-local prefix? 2002::/16 fe80::/10 X ::/8 ff00::/8

  10. Which of the following is the IPv6 multicast prefix? ::/8 ff00::/8 X fe80::/10 2002::/16

  11. Which of the following is the IPv6 ULA (unique local addresses) prefix? fe80::/10 fc00::/7 X 2002::/16 ff00::/8

  12. Which of the following is a subnet of 2001:db8::/32? fe80::20c:dbff:fefb:232b 2001:db8:7fa5::/48 X 2001:db9::/32 2001:db8::/16

  13. On Linux, how would you traceroute to the IPv6 address of he.net? owamp he.net traceroute6 he.net X smokeping he.net tracert6 he.net

  14. On Windows Vista, how would you traceroute to the IPv6 address of he.net? smokeping he.net traceroute6 he.net owamp he.net tracert he.net X

  15. On Linux, what is the IPv6 ping command? pong pingit plonk! ping6 x

  16. Which command forces the UNIX command ssh to use IPv6 to connect to example.com (useful for domains with both A and AAAA records)? ssh -4 example.com ssh -6 example.com X putty example.com ssh6 example.com

  17. You would force the UNIX command ssh to use IPv4 (useful if it had both A and AAAA records) to connect to example.com using which command? ssh4 example.com ssh -6 example.com ssh -4 example.com X putty example.com

  18. Which command forces the UNIX command wget to use IPv6 to make a HTTP GET request to he.net (useful for domains with both A and AAAA records)? http he.net wget -4 he.net wget -6 he.net X wget6 he.net

  19. Which command forces the UNIX command wget to use IPv4 to make a HTTP GET request to he.net (useful for domains with both A and AAAA records)? wget -4 he.net X http he.net wget -6 he.net wget4 he.net

  20. Which command forces the UNIX command mtr to use IPv6 to traceroute to he.net (useful for domains with both A and AAAA records)? mtr6 mtr -4 he.net mtr -6 he.net X ping6 he.net

  21. Which command forces the UNIX command mtr to use IPv4 to traceroute to he.net (useful for domains with both A and AAAA records)? mtr -4 he.net X mtr -6 he.net ping4 he.net mtr4 he.net[/ccW]

  2. Which of the following is a link-local address? ::1 XX :: fe80::20c:dbff:fefb:232b X 3ffe:3200::/32

Which of the following URLs specifies a literal IPv6 address and port number correctly? https://2001:0db8:85a3:08d3:1319:8a2e:0370:7344:443 https:[2001:0db8:85a3:08d3:1319:8a2e:0370:7344]:443 https://[2001:0db8:85a3:08d3:1319:8a2e:0370:7344].443 https://[2001:0db8:85a3:08d3:1319:8a2e:0370:7344]:443 X

  5. If you run native IPv4 and IPv6 at the same time this is called: 6in4 6and4 NAT-PT Dual stack X

  6. How do you use the dig command to get the IPv6 address record for domain he.net? dig he.net 6 dig he.net A dig he.net AAAA X

  7. How do you use the dig command to get the PTR record for the IPv6 address 2001:470:0:76::2? dig 2001:470:0:76::2 dig 2001:470:0:76::2 PTR dig -x 2001:470:0:76::2 X

[/ccW]
